titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Education Program, Office Files of Frank Bowles
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Education Program, Office Files of Frank Bowles FA729
titlestmt.author: Arranged and described by Daniel Bruce May, Ford Foundation Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-16 14:57:04 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Education Program, Office Files of Frank Bowles
did.abstract:
The Education Program Papers of Frank Bowles were transferred to the Ford Foundation Archives in 1982.
The papers consist of correspondence, inter-office memoranda, and reports. They are divided into two series: Conference Files and Correspondence Files. Arrangement within each series maintains the original order established by Bowles' office.
The papers included .3 cubic foot of The Fund for the Advancement of Education material. These files, which Bowles generated during his tenure as President of the Fund, have been incorporated with the TFAE record group.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at https://rockarch.org/collections/access-and-request-materials/#citations.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Staff and consultant reports and publications have been pulled and accessioned into the Ford Foundation Archives. A cross-reference sheet located within the folders denotes accessioned material. A list of titles removed from the papers is appended to this register. Papers not related to FF activities have been removed.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frank Bowles, Ford Foundation Program Advisor in the Middle East and Africa office of the International Division, was a member of the Foundation staff from 1963 until 1969. During this period, he held the following positions:
January 1967, Advisor to the President, International Education, Office of the President
November 1969, Program Advisor, MEA, International Division
Prior to Bowles' career with the Ford Foundation, he held the following positions:
1948-1963, College Entrance Examination Board, Director and President
1960-1962, UNESCO-IAU, Director, International Study of University Admissions
1954, University of Puerto Rico, Consultant on the organization of the Graduate School
1952-1953, TFAE, Director of project studying citizenship education in the Armed Forces
1947, University of Puerto Rico, Special Assistant to the Chancellor
1930-1942, 1945-1948, Columbia University, Assistant to the Director; Acting Director; and Director, University Admissions
Frank Bowles was born November 20, 1907. He received his B.A. and M.A. degrees in 1928 and 1930 respectively, from Columbia University. He was awarded ten honorary doctoral degrees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers, which consist of six boxes of correspondence, inter-office memoranda, and reports, are concerned with the Education Program for the years 1963 to 1968.

The papers, which are broad in scope, include material related to educational conferences, meetings, or activities attended by Bowles; and correspondence with Foundation colleagues, and individuals in academic, grantee, and other organizations involved in or with FF educational activities.
Mr. Bowles, whose role in the Foundation's Education Program was diverse, is refelected by the papers, accessioned reports, and speeches.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Education Program Papers of Frank Bowles are divided into two series:

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Conference Files (1963-1968), Contains material as it relates to FF sponsored travel Bowles undertook in his capacity as Director of the Education Program and Advisor to the President for International Education.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These files are arranged in reverse order of travel taken. Within each folder, the papers are arranged in reverse chronological order.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These folders are arranged in alphabetical order. Within those files which are arranged alphabetically by name of organization or subject matter, the correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Correspondence Files (1962-1968), contains correspondence generated by Mr. Bowles during his years at the Foundation.
